\$CDHIT_SITE_OPTIONS
-T \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1}

param.name: description_len
param.label: Length of the description
param.help: If set to 0, it takes the fasta defline and stops at first space (-d)

param.name: cutoff_diff_len
param.label: Length difference cutoff
param.help: If set to 0.9, the shorter sequences need to be at least 90% length of the representative of the cluster (-s)

param.name: aa_cutoff_diff_len
param.label: Length difference cutoff in amino acid
param.help: If set to 60, the length difference between the shorter sequences and the representative of the cluster can not be bigger than 60 (-S)

param.name: style
param.label: global or local alignments
param.help: Local sequence identity, calculated as : number of identical amino acids in alignment divided by the length of the alignment. You must set alignment coverage by length or fraction.

param.name: align_coverage_long
param.label: Alignment coverage for the longer sequence
param.help: If set to 0.9, the alignment must covers 90% of the sequence (-aL)

param.name: align_coverage_long_control
param.label: Alignment coverage control for the longer sequence
param.help: If set to 60, and the sequence's length 400,then the alignment must be at least 340 (400-60) residues (-AL)

param.name: align_coverage_short
param.label: Alignment coverage for the shorter sequence

param.name: align_coverage_short_control
param.label: Alignment coverage control for the shorter sequence

param.name: align_coverage_min
param.label: Minimal alignment coverage control for the both sequences
param.help: Alignment must cover at least this value for both sequences (-A)

param.name: cluster_type
param.label: Slow Cluster
param.help: In cd-hit's default algorithm, a sequence is clustered to the first cluster that meet the threshold (fast cluster). If set to slow, the program will cluster it into the most similar cluster that meet the threshold (accurate but slow mode). This won't change the representatives of final clusters (-g)
